00001 #!/usr/bin/env python

00003 import glob, os, time
00004 from graphics.numpytools import *
00005 from scipy import linspace

00007 
00008 import sys
00009 backend = os.environ.get('easyviz_backend','gnuplot_') # vtk backend default
00010 legal_backends = 'vtk_ gnuplot_ pyx_ blt_'.split()
00011 if len(sys.argv) > 1:
00012     if not sys.argv[1] in legal_backends:
00013         print "no such backend as %s, using default (vtk_)" % sys.argv[1]
00014     else:
00015         backend = sys.argv[1]
00016         sys.argv = sys.argv[:1] + sys.argv[2:]
00017 try:
00018     exec('from graphics.%s import *' % backend)
00019 except:
00020     print 'could not import backend %s' % backend
00021     sys.exit(1)

00023 def _test_labels():
00024     xx,yy,zz = get_data()
00025 
00026     print "testing labels..."
00027     mesh(zz, title='mesh with default labels', show=screenplot)
00028     show()
00029     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00030     mesh(zz, title='mesh with new labels (using x-, y-, and zlabel methods)',
00031          show=screenplot)
00032     xlabel('x-axis'); ylabel('y-axis'); zlabel('z-axis')
00033     show()
00034     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00035     surf(zz,title='surface with new labels (using keyword arguments)',
00036          xlabel='x2',ylabel='y2',zlabel='z2', show=screenplot)

00064     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00065 
00066     print "testing axis using the axis method..."

00069     axis(xmin=-.5,xmax=.5,ymin=-1,ymax=1)

00071     show()

00088     xx,yy,zz = get_data()

00090     print "testing different views..."
00091     mesh(zz, title='view: default', hidden='on', show=screenplot)
00092     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00093     mesh(zz,view=(40,70), title='view: (40,70)', hidden='on', show=screenplot)
00094     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00095     surf(zz, show=screenplot)
00096     hidden('on')
00097     title('view: (70,40)')
00098     view(70,40)
00099     show()

00102     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00103     surf(zz,title='default 2D view', hidden='on', view=2, show=screenplot)

00105 def _test_quiver():
00106     xx,yy,zz = get_data(step=.5)
00107     xv = xx*ones(zz.shape)
00108     yv = yy*ones(zz.shape)
00109     uu = xv+1
00110     vv = yv+1
00111     
00112     print "testing quiver..."
00113     quiver(xx,yy,uu*0+.9,vv*0+.4, title="quiver(xx,yy,uu*0+.9,vv*0+.4)",
00114            show=screenplot)
00115     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00116 ##     quiver(seq(len(ravel(xx))-1),yy,uu,vv,
00117 ##            title="quiver(seq(len(xx.flat)-1),yy,uu,vv)", show=screenplot)
00118 ##     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00119     quiver(yv,xv,vv*0+.9,uu*0+.9, title="quiver(yv,xv,vv*0+.9,uu*0+.9)",
00120            show=screenplot)
00121     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00122     quiver(xx,yy,uu,vv, title="quiver(xx,yy,uu,vv)", show=screenplot)
00123     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00124     quiver(uu,vv,'filled', 'g', title="quiver(uu,vv,'filled','g')",
00125            show=screenplot)
00126     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00127     quiver(uu,vv,'r:.', title="quiver(uu,vv,'r:.')",show=screenplot)

00129 def _test_contours():

00131 
00132     print "testing contours..."
00133     # testing contour(...):
00134     contour(xx,yy,zz,title="2D contour plot using contour(xx,yy,zz)",
00135             show=screenplot)

00137     contour(xx,yy,zz,20,
00138             title="2D contour plot with 20 levels using contour(xx,yy,zz,20)",
00139             show=screenplot)
00140     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00141     contour(xx,yy,zz,seq(arrmin(zz),arrmax(zz),1), 
00142             title="contour(xx,yy,zz,seq(arrmin(zz),arrmax(zz),1))",
00143             show=screenplot)
00144     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00145     contour(xx,yy,zz,[-0.2,-0.5,0.2,0.5], 
00146             title="contour(xx,yy,zz,[-0.2,-0.5,0.2,0.5])", show=screenplot)
00147     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00148     contour(zz,15, clabels='on', title="contour(zz,clabels='on')",
00149             show=screenplot)
00150     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00151 
00152     # testing contour3(...):
00153     contour3(xx,yy,zz, title="3D contour plot using contour3(xx,yy,zz)",
00154              show=screenplot)

00161              show=screenplot)

00169           title="20 contour levels using meshc(zz,clevels=20)",
00170           show=screenplot)
00171     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00172 
00173     # testing surfc(...):

00175           title="Surface with contours using surfc(zz)", show=screenplot)
00176     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00177     surfc(zz, cvector=[-0.2,-0.5,0.2,0.5], hidden='on',
00178           title="surfc(zz,cvector=[-0.2,-0.5,0.2,0.5])", show=screenplot)
00179     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00180     
00181     surfc(zz, clevels=15, clabels='on', hidden='on', 
00182           title="surfc(zz,clevels=10,clabels='on')", show=screenplot)
00183     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00184

00192 def _test_colormaps():
00193     xx,yy,zz = get_data()
00194     
00195     # typical usage:
00196     # mesh(xx,yy,zz,colormap=hot())
00197     # or
00198     # colormap(hsv()); mesh(xx,yy,zz)
00199 
00200     colormaps = 'hsv,hot,gray,bone,copper,pink,white,flag,lines,colorcube,'\
00201                 'jet,cool,autumn,spring,winter,summer'.split(',')
00202 
00203     print "testing colormaps..."
00204     # surf looks better in vtk:
00205     #if backend == 'vtk_':
00206     #    mesh = surf
00207     mesh(zz,title="colormap: default", show=screenplot)
00208     for cmap in colormaps:
00209         next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00210         try:
00211             exec('c=%s()' % cmap)
00212             mesh(zz,colormap=c,title="colormap: '%s'" % cmap,
00213                  colorbar='on', hidden='on', show=screenplot)
00214         except NotImplementedError, msg:
00215             print msg

00282 def _test_figure():
00283     x=seq(-2,2,.1)
00284     plot(x**2, title="Plotting into figure 1: plot(x**2)")
00285     #f1=gcf()
00286     next(False, prompt, pause, psplot)
00287     
00288     figure(2)
00289     plot(x,x**3,'r', title="Plotting into figure 2: plot(x,x**3,'r')")
00290     #f2=gcf()
00291     next(False, prompt, pause, psplot)
00292 
00293     figure(1)
00294     plot(x,x,'r', title="Plotting into figure 1: plot(x,x)")

00344 def _test_legend():
00345     x=seq(-2,2,.2)
00346     colors = 'r g b c m y k'.split()
00347     hold('on')
00348     for i in range(len(colors)):
00349         plot(x,x+i,'%s'%colors[i],legend='x+%d'%i)

00351 def _test_lights():
00352     x=seq(-3,3,.1)
00353     xx,yy=meshgrid(x,x)
00354     zz=peaks(xx,yy)
00355     surf(zz,title='No lights')
00356     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00357     
00358     surf(zz,light=Light(),title='default light')
00359     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00360     
00361     surf(zz,light=Light(lightpos=(-10,-10,10),lightcolor=(.5,.5,.5)),
00362          title='light at (-10,-10,10) and color (0,0,1)')
00363     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00364     
00365     surf(zz,title='No lights')

00367 def _test_pcolor():
00368     n = 6;
00369     r = seq(0,n,1)[:,NewAxis]/n;
00370     theta = pi*seq(-n,n)/n;
00371     X = r*cos(theta);
00372     Y = r*sin(theta);
00373     C = r*cos(2*theta);
00374     pcolor(X,Y,C,
00375            axis='image',
00376            title='pcolor plot')
00377     
00378 def _test_subplot():

00388          title='subplot(1,2,2); surf(xx,yy,xx*xx)',
00389          show=screenplot)
00390     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00391 
00392     subplot(2,1,2)
00393     xv = xx*ones(zz.shape)
00394     yv = yy*ones(zz.shape)
00395     quiver(xv,yv,'b', title="subplot(2,1,2); quiver(xx,yy,'b')",
00396            show=screenplot)
00397     subplot(2,1,1)
00398     plot([1,2,3],'bo-',[4,5,6],'rx-', show=screenplot)
00399     subplot(2,1,2)
00400     mesh(zz, show=screenplot)
00401     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00402 
00403     subplot(2,2,1)
00404     surf(xx,yy,xx*xx*ones(zz.shape),
00405          title="subplot(2,2,1); surf(xx,yy,xx*xx)", 
00406          hidden=1, show=screenplot)

00409          title="subplot(2,2,2); surf(xx,yy,-yy*yy)", 
00410          hidden=1, show=screenplot)
00411     subplot(2,2,3)
00412     surf(xx,yy,xx*yy, title="subplot(2,2,3); surf(xx,yy,xx*yy)",
00413          hidden=1, show=screenplot)

00416          hidden=1, show=screenplot)

00418 def _test_subplot2():
00419     subplot(2,2,1)
00420     #xx,yy,zz = meshgrid(seq(-2,2,.2), seq(-2,2,.25), seq(-2,2,.16))
00421     x = seq(-2,2,.2)
00422     xx,yy,zz=meshgrid(x,x,x)
00423     vv = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2-zz**2)
00424     slice_(xx, yy, zz, vv, [-1.2,.8,2], 2, [-2,-.2], shading='interp',
00425            colormap=jet(),
00426            #xmin=-1,xmax=1,ymin=-1,ymax=1,zmin=-1,zmax=1,
00427            title='slices',
00428            #daspect=[1,1,1.5],
00429            )
00430     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00431 
00432     subplot(2,2,2)
00433     x=linspace(0,3,80); y=sin(2*pi*x); theta=2*pi*x+pi/2;
00434     quiver(x,y,sin(theta)/10,cos(theta)/10,0.04,'b')
00435     hold('on'); plot(x,y,'r'); hold('off')
00436     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00437 
00438     subplot(2,2,3)
00439     x = seq(-8,8,.2)
00440     xx,yy = meshgrid(x,x)
00441     r = sqrt(xx**2+yy**2) + 0.01
00442     zz = sin(r)/r
00443     surfc(xx,yy,zz,colormap=jet(),colorbar='on',cbtitle='test',
00444           zmin=-0.5,zmax=1,clevels=10,
00445           shading='interp',
00446           title='r=sqrt(x**2+y**2)+eps, sin(r)/r',
00447           light=Light(position=(-10,-10,5)),
00448           )
00449     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00450 
00451     subplot(2,2,4)
00452 
00453     x = seq(-2,2,.2)
00454     xx,yy,zz=meshgrid(x,x,x)
00455     vv = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2-zz**2)
00456     isosurface(xx,yy,zz,vv,0.001,colormap=hsv(),shading='interp',
00457                title='isosurface')
00458     hold('on')
00459     isosurface(xx,yy,zz,vv,-0.1,shading='interp',
00460                bgcolor=(0,0,0), fgcolor=(1,1,1),
00461                #axis='tight',
00462                box='on')

00464 def _test_streamribbon():
00465     xmin = -7; xmax = 7
00466     ymin = -7; ymax = 7 
00467     zmin = -7; zmax = 7 
00468     x = linspace(xmin,xmax,20)
00469     y = linspace(ymin,ymax,30)
00470     z = linspace(zmin,zmax,20)
00471     x,y,z = meshgrid(x,y,z)
00472     nx, ny, nz = x.shape[0], y.shape[1], z.shape[2]
00473     x = x*ones((nx,ny,nz))
00474     y = y*ones((nx,ny,nz))
00475     z = z*ones((nx,ny,nz))
00476     tmp = x.copy()
00477     x = y
00478     y = tmp
00479     u = y*ones((nx,ny,nz))
00480     v = -x*ones((nx,ny,nz))
00481     w = 0*x*ones((nx,ny,nz))+1
00482 
00483     set(show=False)
00484     hold('on')
00485     daspect([1,1,1])
00486     cx,cy,cz = meshgrid(linspace(xmin,xmax,30),linspace(ymin,ymax,30),[-3,4])
00487     #h2=coneplot(x,y,z,u,v,w,cx,cy,cz, 'q')
00488     #set(h2, 'color', 'k');
00489       
00490     sx,sy,sz = meshgrid(seq(-1,1),seq(-1,1),array([-6]*3))

00492     sy = sy*ones((3,3,3))
00493     sz = sz*ones((3,3,3))

00510 def _test_streamtube():
00511     x = seq(-2,2,1)
00512     xx,yy,zz=meshgrid(x,x,x)
00513     vv = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2-zz**2)
00514     px,py,pz = gradient(vv)
00515     streamtube(xx,yy,zz,px,py,pz,[0.1]*5,[-.5,-.2,0,.1,.5],seq(-2,2,1),
00516                #zmin=-.2,zmax=.2,
00517                daspect=[1,1,1],
00518                view=3,
00519                )

00521 def _test_streamline():
00522     x = seq(-2,2,.2)
00523     xx,yy = meshgrid(x,x)
00524     zz = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2)
00525     px,py = gradient(zz)
00526     print "testing streamlines..."
00527     streamline(xx,yy,px,py,[.2,-.2],[-.5,-.5],.2,
00528                title='streamlines (plus vector and contour plot)',
00529                hold='on')
00530     quiver(xx,yy,px,py,4)
00531     contour(xx,yy,zz,10)
00532     
00533     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00534     hold('off')
00535     xx,yy,zz=meshgrid(x,x,x)
00536     vv = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2-zz**2)
00537     px,py,pz = gradient(vv)
00538     streamline(xx,yy,zz,px,py,pz,x,x,x,title='more streamlines')

00564 def _test_isosurface():

00570                shading='interp',

00572                title='isosurface with isovalue at 0.001 and -0.1')

00594 def _test_shading():
00595     xx,yy,zz = get_data()
00596     print "testing different shadings..."
00597     surf(zz,shading='faceted',title="shading: 'faceted' (default)")
00598     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00599     surf(zz,shading='flat',title="shading: 'flat'")
00600     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00601     surf(zz,shading='interp',title="shading: 'interp'")

00603 def _test_quiver3():
00604     # http://www.monolith.uwaterloo.ca/software/matlab/HTML/help/techdoc/creating_plots/chspec24.html
00605     vz = 10  # Velocity
00606     a = -32  # Acceleration
00607     t = seq(0,1,.1)
00608     z = vz*t + 1./2*a*t**2
00609     vx = 2
00610     x = vx*t
00611     vy = 3
00612     y = vy*t
00613     u = gradient(x)
00614     v = gradient(y)
00615     w = gradient(z)
00616     scale = 0
00617     quiver3(x,y,z,u,v,w,scale,
00618             view=[70,18],
00619             grid='on',
00620             xmin=0,xmax=3.5,ymin=0,ymax=3,zmin=-10,zmax=2,
00621             show=screenplot,
00622             )
00623     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00624     
00625     x = seq(-3,3,1)
00626     xx,yy,zz = meshgrid(x,x,x)
00627     nx, ny, nz = shape(xx+yy+zz)
00628     xv = xx*ones((1,ny,nz))
00629     yv = yy*ones((nx,1,nz))
00630     zv = zz*ones((nx,ny,1))
00631     quiver3(xv,yv,zv,xv,yv,zv,'r',
00632             view=3,
00633             axis=[-5,5,-5,5,-5,5],
00634             daspect=[1,1,1],
00635             grid='on',
00636             show=screenplot,
00637             )
00638     next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00639 
00640     x = seq(-2,2,1)
00641     xx,yy=meshgrid(x,x)
00642     zz = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2)
00643     uu = array([[0.0125,   -0.0003,   -0.0067,   -0.0003,    0.0125],
00644                 [0.2429,   -0.0066,   -0.1341,   -0.0066,    0.2429],
00645                 [0.5628,   -0.0183,   -0.3453,   -0.0183,    0.5628],
00646                 [0.2429,   -0.0066,   -0.1341,   -0.0066,    0.2429],
00647                 [0.0125,   -0.0003,   -0.0067,   -0.0003,    0.0125]])
00648     vv = array([[0.0076,    0.0764,         0,   -0.0764,   -0.0076],
00649                 [0.0174,    0.1777,         0,   -0.1777,   -0.0174],
00650                 [     0,         0,         0,         0,         0],
00651                 [-0.0174,  -0.1777,         0,    0.1777,    0.0174],
00652                 [-0.0076,  -0.0764,         0,    0.0764,    0.0076]])
00653     ww = array([[0.9999,    0.9971,    1.0000,    0.9971,    0.9999],
00654                 [0.9699,    0.9841,    0.9910,    0.9841,    0.9699],
00655                 [0.8266,    0.9998,    0.9385,    0.9998,    0.8266],
00656                 [0.9699,    0.9841,    0.9910,    0.9841,    0.9699],
00657                 [0.9999,    0.9971,    1.0000,    0.9971,    0.9999]])
00658 
00659     quiver3(xx,yy,zz,uu,vv,ww)
00660     hold('on')
00661     surf(xx,yy,zz)

00663 
00664 def next(clear_figure=False, prompt='next plot', pause=0,
00665          save_hardcopy=False):
00666     if save_hardcopy:
00667         global hardcopy_counter
00668         hardcopy(filename='tmp_easyviz_plot%03d.ps' % hardcopy_counter,
00669                  color=True, fontname='Helvetica', fontsize=18)
00670         hardcopy_counter += 1
00671     if prompt:
00672         raw_input(prompt)
00673     if pause:
00674         time.sleep(pause)
00675     if clear_figure:
00676         clf()
00677 
00678 def get_data(step=.1):
00679     x = seq(-2,2,step)
00680     xx,yy = meshgrid(x,x)
00681     zz = peaks(xx,yy)
00682     return xx,yy,zz

00684 def _tests(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot):
00685     _test_labels(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00686     _test_axis(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00687     _test_view(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00688     _test_quiver(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00689     _test_contours(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00690     _test_colormaps(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00691     _test_caxis(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00692     _test_box(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00693     _test_grid(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00694     _test_colorbar(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00695     _test_figure(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00696     _test_hardcopy_only(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00697 
00698     if backend in ['vtk_', 'gnuplot_']:
00699         _test_plot3(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00700         _test_subplot(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00701 
00702     if backend in ['vtk_']:
00703         _test_pcolor(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00704         _test_quiver3(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00705         _test_shading(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00706         _test_streamline(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00707         _test_slice_(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00708         _test_isosurface(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00709         _test_subplot2(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00710         _test_streamribbon(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00711         _test_streamtube(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00712         _test_lights(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00713         # why is the streamribbon object still present in ax.plotitems???
00714         gca()._prop['plotitems'] = []
00715         _test_legend(); next(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00716     
00717 if __name__ == '__main__':
00718     # command-line arguments: n screenplot flash psplot
00719     # screenplot: show plots on the screen?
00720     # flash: drop prompt between plots and clf, everything goes into one plot
00721     # psplot: make hardcopy of each plot?
00722 
00723     # 1 0 1 1 gives execution in batch without user interaction
00724     
00725     import sys
00726     global hardcopy_counter, clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot, screenplot
00727     try: n = int(sys.argv[1])
00728     except: n = 1
00729     try: screenplot = bool(int(sys.argv[2]))
00730     except: screenplot = True
00731     try: flash = bool(int(sys.argv[3]))
00732     except: flash = True
00733     try: psplot = bool(int(sys.argv[4]))
00734     except: psplot = True
00735 
00736     hardcopy_counter = 0
00737     if flash:
00738         # let all plots flash on the screen with 1 s pause
00739         clear_figure = False
00740         prompt = ''
00741         pause = 1
00742     else:
00743         # press return for each plot on the screen
00744         clear_figure = False
00745         prompt = 'next test'
00746         pause = 0
00747     #_tests(clear_figure, prompt, pause, psplot)
00748     _tests(True, prompt, pause, psplot)
